brief_description: Control study was unable to distinguish between placental and contamination control sample bacterial species and abundance
brief_title: Evaluating differences between healthy placental microbiome and contamination control sample microbiomes
description: Placental samples from healthy deliveries were compared to an extensive set of  bacterial contamination controls as well as to oral and vaginal samples from the same women. This control study was unable to distinguish bacterial species and abundance between placental and contamination control samples
hypothesis: Placental bacteria is not derived from environmental contamination
objectives: Distinguish between healthy placental and contamination control sample microbiomes
official_title: Inability to distinguish placental microbiome samples from contamination controls

arm.description: Tissue harvested from placentas of healthy humans
arm.name: Healthy humans

personnel.organization: University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine
personnel.site_name: University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine

pubmed.title: Comparison of placenta samples with contamination controls does not provide evidence for a distinct placenta microbiota.
